      Layer another sample onto this one lazily

      • layerOnThisLazy

        public void layerOnThisLazy(Samples toLayer,
                            int offset1,
                            int offset2)
        Layer another sample onto this one lazily
        Offsets are in values/samples, not seconds
        First offset is offset in this
        Second offset is offset in samples to layer
        Tries to do full layering
        Parameters:
        toLayer - the sampled data to layer
        offset1 - the offset in this object
        offset2 - the offset in the other object

        offset2 - the offset in the other object

      • getSpectrum

        public double[][] getSpectrum()
        Returns:
        double array array containing the spectrum, first array is real component, second is imaginary

      • autoUpdate

        public void autoUpdate()
        Check for discrepancy, automatically choose FFT or IFFT
        Use via API is discouraged, know whether you want FFT or IFFT and call that instead

      • checkFft

        public void checkFft()
        Check if samples changed, do FFT if so

        public void fft(int newHash)
        Single argument passed is precalculated sample hash
        Spectrum hash will be updated after to match

        public void ifft(int newHash)

        newHash - spectrum hash

      • applyCurveTo

        public static void applyCurveTo(Curve curve,
                                double sampleRate,
                                double[] target)
        Apply curve to some array as an envelope
        Parameters:
        curve - the curve to multiply pointwisely
        sampleRate - sample rate in Hz, determines mapping multiplier
        target - target array to modify in place

      • applyCurveToInParallel

        public static void applyCurveToInParallel(Curve curve,
                                          double sampleRate,
                                          double[]... targets)
        Apply curve to some arrays as an envelope
        Parameters:
        curve - the curve to multiply pointwisely
        sampleRate - sample rate in Hz, determines mapping multiplier
        targets - target arrays to modify in place

      • applyCurveToData

        public void applyCurveToData(Curve curve)
        Apply curve as envelope to sample data
        Parameters:
        curve - the curve to apply

      • applyCurveToSpectrum

        public void applyCurveToSpectrum(Curve curve)
        Apply curve as envelope to spectrum correctly
        Doing the extra calculation is necessary, otherwise the mapping will be wrong. Do not ever pass the spectrum directly to applyCurveToInParallel. Use this method.
        Parameters:
        curve - the curve to apply

      • slice

        public double[] slice(int start,
                      int end)
        Returns a slice of the sampled data
        Length of copied data will be end - start
        Parameters:
        start - the index of the item to start with, inclusive
        end - the index of the item to end with, exclusive
        Returns:
        that particular slice
